page.title: 07Milk Quota effects - Longnor
page.content:
We interviewed a corn traveller at the Corn Merchant's in Longnor to see whether milk quotas have affected the sale of corn and other sundries. He said that last year corn sales were down, but this year they have levelled off because the quotas have not been reduced so much this year.
They are selling more milk replacer for beef calves but no extra beef nuts. The sales of ewe, lamb and sheep nuts are up considerably.
The price of corn has not gone up partly because of the huge surplus of grain, in fact the price of feeding stuffs had gone down by 20 pounds per tonne.
